Resume

I have a combined 7 years of experience in designing for and building the web.

With a formal background in psychology, my strengths lie in analyzing human behavior from quantitative and qualitative user research. I use these insights to inspire or back up the design rationale behind new and better products.

Work experience

Rock Creek Strategic Marketing/CHIEF

Senior User Experience Strategist

Helping define the vision for a growing UX team at a digital strategy agency that specializes in government products.

  • Design, moderate, analyze, and present UX research for 2 government products, including re-design of the Securities and Exchange Commission's EDGAR database.
  • Working with UX practice lead to act as mentor and supervisor to 2 members of UX team.
  • Establishing a more effective design review process within UX, and with marketing, development, and project management teams.
  • Working with Creative Director and agency Partners to develop client pitches.

Current

Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB)

User Experience Strategist (Rock Creek Strategic Marketing)

Interface design, user experience research, and HTML prototyping for an in-house design team. The CFPB is a 21st century federal government agency that engages consumers to take more control over their financial lives.

  • Helped establish an Agile culture within the user experience team.
  • Designed user interfaces and collaborated with multi-displinary Scrum team to implement and iterate deliverables.
  • Helped product owners and subject matter experts establish a product's vision by designing, moderating, and analyzing user research.
  • Specialized on designing products centered around the mortgage industry, from simple financial advice content for consumers to detailed research tools for industry experts.
